example: The cat absconded with my sock in her mouth.

mommentary: Momism of the Year 2016
example: I used to work in academic medicine

definition: I think this is right but if I'm wrong it isn't my fault.
example: According to conventional wisdom, you'll get a cold if you go to sleep with wet hair.
Phoebe was a feline after my own heart

mommentary: Our only momism with an audio guide
example: Ah no no no no, you're not leaving this bathroom with my comb

definition: A heavy burden, an irritating obligation

example: Pick out anything you might wish from the grocery store

definition: To fail to prevent or be partially responsible for something unpleasant happening
To fail to prevent or be partially responsible for something unpleasant happening
At your core, it is a fundamental part of your personality
example: You're a researcher at heart

definition: Doing a habitual or characteristic action
example: I'm at it again with the hot sauce!

mommentary: Other nicknames include: milk-face, straight-A baby, Imelda-beth, queenie, tootsie, Tootsa-beth, and the Boo Hoo Baby

definition: I'll be back in a moment

mommentary: I got this one from blue-eyes as well. I think the cat was playing in her water bowl and spilled it over one time too many
definition: Improper orneriness with respect to the cat

mommentary: This was the title of a Ronald Reagan movie. I don't think I'd want to include it in a list of momisms, no matter how much or little I might have ever said those words
Mother-identified momism
definition: Speak to someone at great length

example: She was all bent out of shape after hearing the president's speech
If I could eat hot sauce, you can bet your rotting apples that I would
There are a lot of bird-brained drivers on the road today--be careful or they'll be scraping you off the roadway
Your brother's bizarro mattress

definition: A condescending phrase used to patronize someone for being foolish or not very bright
example: You failed the exam because you thought the sun was a planet? Aw, bless your pointy little head
After that day-long walk with my daughter, I was feeling pretty blitzed

mommentary: I used to look in the mirror with my brown eyes and wonder where his blue eyes came from
example: Blue-eyed wonder

mommentary: Some people see him and walk the other way if they want to get anything done in the next hour.
example: Cussing a blue streak, or does he still talk a blue streak?

mommentary: Other people don't say mind boggling? Huh-what is this world coming to?! (Other people do say "mind-boggling" but say much less often "Boggles the mind!")
definition: This revelation is astounding or otherwise is a lot to take in
example: Why anyone would want to stay inside on a beautiful day like this I'll never understand, it boggles the mind!

mommentary: Considering his English heritage, I couldn't believe huh-what a tan he could get!

momism: Bug in their ear about something
example: We'll try to put a bug in his ear about that

definition: An object someone likes to play or tinker with
example: My sonnnn is playing with his new busybox, the piano

definition: A bad thing happened but it could have been worse!
example: The dog ran away but we got him home before mom found out, so we're butter-side up.

momism: By any stretch of the imagination

definition: An exclamation used to express astonishment, approval, etc.

example: If you don't can it with the noise, there'll be consequences

momism: Can't beat it with a stick!

definition: Mother's favorite Sicilian mafia reference, meaning "Do you understand?"
example: Give your sister half of that sandwich, capisce?
After Baby Doll beat that kid in three moves at chess, she looked like the cat that ate the canary

definition: Anything fascinating to a cat such as birds outside a window.
example: The fish tank is cat TV as far as she's concerned.

mommentary: Also known as chin over the trash can and chin over a plate
definition: To prevent crumbs, mom asked her children to eat with their chin over a plate/trash can/sink

mommentary: Other people say this but not nearly as often as our mother. Other variants of this include "chisel away at"
example: I’m chipping away at my taxes
She's being a real chow hound — I think she might be in a growth spurt!

mommentary: Pronounced choop
definition: An encouragement to move or hurry
example: Chup, chup! You cat

mommentary: Other people don’t say that? Kids: no!
example: Tuesday I was starting to circle the drain. By Wednesday I was down it.

mommentary: I just said that a couple of weeks ago at the grocery store. I had searched high and low for ricotta cheese and couldn't find it. A worker in the deli explained the container system. Then I told a second worker that the first had just clued me in. At the time I wondered if he knew "clued in" since maybe his first language isn't English, but all went well. Momism didn't occur to me...
example: Your coworker just clued me in. I want a medium-sized container of ricotta.

definition: Motivated someone to act a particular way
example: Dunno huh-what’s come over me but I’m on a packing binge.
After all that cooing, that baby conked right out!
If you don’t pipe down, there’ll be consequences
Now that the squirrels have decided to leave my tomatoes alone, things are copacetic in the yard.
Crapola, my weather station fell off the salad plate.
She was quite cross and corrected me: 'it's woo-wee-sa!'

definition: Consulting the dictionary multiple times has not clarified what this means
example: Your friend is quite daft

definition: As the kids would say, "I just can't even." Melodramatic way of saying that one cannot handle the shenanigans or problems at hand
example: This rainy weather will be the death of me! (i.e. I haven't been outside in 3 hours, I shall surely perish!)
He came in looking like death warmed over; I think he's coming down with something

definition: The instruction manual, such as to a blender.
example: After reading through the destructions, I decided to press the red button.
I had a dim recollection that you’d taken off with that meemer

mommentary: Mom's habit of replacing banal words with melodrama.
example: Your shorts are looking pretty dingy, sonnn.
If you think this Camry is small, my old Datsun was a dinky car!
That walk with your sister just about did me in
Jordan's a doll

momism: Don't go away mad, just go away

definition: Gesundheit. This is mom's response to a sneeze
example: Now don't you start.

mommentary: Kids: A mythical land where most of our favourite toys suddenly lived
definition: Indicates an object is destined for donation
example: That old tent is going to donation-land.
alt: That old tent is going to donation-land.avif

example: Doozie is a doozie of a momism, I'd say
Ok, down the hatch with this pill!

mommentary: Sometimes as "right nippy" or just "nippy"

example: Your brother is really dragging his anchor this morning

definition: A handle or knob for a drawer
example: Your drawer pull has screws coming along it the other side

definition: Consulting the dictionary multiple times has not clarified what this means
example: That's droll
If I had my druthers, there'd be more hot sauce in this salad.
She seems pretty dubious, in my view
If I want to move, I'd better get my ducks in a row.

mommentary: There used to be laundromats with names such as "Duds and Suds" back in the day
example: She's got some pretty fine duds
I always loved that little dune buggy

definition: A stern (often unwanted) lecture, unsollicited and voluminous advice
example: I got an earful if I ever forgot to feed Milo her supper

mommentary: My dad used to say that
example: If George the Younger gets elected, I'll eat my hat
You, daughter of mine, are pear-shaped, which incidentally is associated with better cardiovascular benefits than the classic hourglass, whereas I've always been egg-shaped

mommentary: Blue-eyes: "Far be it from me" is a biblical expression so not a momism. Killer baby: Ok, but has anyone else said it since Jesus?
example: Far be it from me to tell you how to live your life, daughter of mine, I just don't see how you manage without hot sauce in your cupboard!

mommentary: Also known as the stay-puff marshmallow mom
definition: Someone is following their usual pattern. Usage: [insert the blank] lives!
example: *burp* Fermenter-mom lives!

mommentary: Kids: we're not dogs, you know. Mom: Nonetheless, you three are very fetching!
example: Can you fetch me my glasses?
That last hill just about finished me off

definition: When mom attributes an opinion on a topic to having grown up in Florida
example: The Floridian in me will never get used to this nippy weather!
Mom, where's my blender? "Sonnnn, I haven't the foggiest"
We can't get beeber out of her hands for love nor money

mommentary: Who’s Pete?
example: For Pete’s sake, where’d you get that vintage vacuum cleaner?

mommentary: A momism from a surprising source: dad
example: This oatmeal is for the birds

mommentary: Oh, hmm. I do say that. No one else? Good one!
example: For the life of me, I can't figure out why no one else wants my extra-spicy, ulcer-guaranteed stir fry
No more supersized hearts. Bummer. Facebook is no fun a-tall anymore.
Gadzookies, my laptop lives
A garden variety stroller

mommentary: This definition is from mom
definition: A tschotske, a bric-a-brac, a decorative item that doesn't have much real value such as a lawn flamingo.

example: I used a gemisch of spices

mommentary: As I remember it, for some time I had been referring to George the 2nd [editor's note:  George the 2nd is also a momism that, for efficiency, we've rolled into this one] as George the Younger [an additional momism], but after a phone call with my sister, I began to include the alternative of George the Lesser.
definition: Refers to 43rd American president George W. Bush
example: If George the Lesser gets elected, I'll eat my hat

definition: Consulting the dictionary multiple times has not clarified what this means.
example: I will gather all the documents that are germane
I used to get after him about never adding salt
It's February so I'd better get hopping on my taxes.
Who got into the cookies?
I'll need to get my act together to come visit Canada this summer
Huh-what are you two getting up to in the cupboard?

mommentary: Identified in another momist example
example: Give it a rest, sonnnn! Your long-suffering mama needs a few winks

momism: Give it the old college try

example: Better buy a new phone before this one gives up the ghost
After they turned down the heat, all my orchids went belly up

momism: Go over like a lead balloon
definition: Something did not go over well at all, not be well received, be unpopular, even resented
example: When I offered to share some of my hot sauce, it went over like a lead balloon
Huh-what are you going on about, sonnnn?

mommentary: I got that one from my mom. She didn't have a high opinion of government work, akin to I think R. Reagan's opinion that the most terrifying words in the English language are "I'm from the government and I'm here to help." But in truth I never asked her huh-hat she meant exactly, this is just my best guess. She was very conservative, also worked for the Dade County School Board (government, alas) for many years, so also just a tad hypocritical

example: Good grief, it's cold out

mommentary: I think that's a common euphemism among people in my age group, but I might be unusual in still using the word huh-while others have moved on
Mom's habit of "noshing" (is that a momism too?)
example: I've been doing a lot of grazing since baby doll left.

momism: Great [insert the blank] of the Western world
example: The great potato-eater of the Western world
Great Scot, I'm certainly getting my daily exercise going up and down this chair moving boxes!
Another piece of chicken? You must be growing.

definition: A sudden increase in height, usually related to a sudden increase in hunger
example: I could buy you these shoes, but they wouldn't fit you by your next growth spurt.

definition: Healthy, strong, "in good shape" (the momism, not to indicate athleticism per say)
example: Well, you [kids] have always been a hale and hearty bunch, it's no surprise you're also strong--remember moving me into my new apartment throwing those boxes around like they were filled with air?

mommentary: Momisms in pig latin are even harder to fathom
example: Allooo-hay sonnnn! That was pig latin for halloooooo.

definition: Spread the word that one is starting a business
example: I'm gonna hang out my shingle and become a babysitter

mommentary: Mother-identified momism

definition: An annoying and/or scary health saga
On course for disaster, rapidly deteriorating
example: If that daughter of mine walks me up one more hill, this trip is going to hell in a handbasket

mommentary: Mom's go-to threat
example: If you take one a bite out of my sandwich, there'll be hell to pay!
With Herculean effort I put the hash browns in the freezer
You might want to hippety hop over there to get that last pair of jeans

mommentary: As I remember it, brown boy & blue-eyes have hyperextensible jaw joints, which means you are more at risk for jaw dislocation, so be careful with those hippopotamus yawns!

definition: This suffix indicates a thing will be moved or hauled.
example: If Alison doesn't want this lamp, it's goodwill-ho.

definition: Imperative: calm down or be patient

example: She's turning 50? Holy smokes!

definition: To walk, implication that it might be a long one
example: "Do you want a ride to the library?" "On a temperate day like this? No, I'll hoof it, thank you very much!"

mommentary: Mother-identified momism. Variant: a "bunch of hooie"
example: Huh-what a bunch of hooie

definition: 1.) Hilarious 2) Don't care at all 3) Worthless
example: Because it's not worth a hoot, I don't give a hoot, but still, huh-what a hoot!
Hop to, you three! We're going to be late, why are you all in front of the TV?!

mommentary: Definition: a cleaned up version of bs
example: Huh-what I learned in school was a bunch of horse hockey
If you don't give that toy back to your brother, you're gonna be in hot water!

mommentary: PS We think it's huh-larious.
definition: Mother's odd aspirated h on question words that only began when she "discovered she does it" in linguistics grad school
example: Huh-why sonnnn, who-all is saying it's a momism huh-when or huh-where I say huh-what?

definition: Said to someone who was extremely ill but is showing recent signs of spunk
example: If you're fighting with your brother, I think you're gonna live.

momism: I wish this dang thing would stop taking pictures of my pocket. (*click*)
mommentary: I wish it would quit taking pictures of the inside of my pocket, to be exact
definition: Mom's technological frustration with the camera in her pocket

example: Now that's a momism if I ever heard one
Your friend seems a little dubious, if you ask me
My new phone is a little iffy

mommentary: A momism partially by virtue of how often mom says it.
example: This hot sauce'll do in a pinch.
Your friend seems a little daft, in my view

momism: In the overall scheme of things
mommentary: Other people don't say that?
definition: All things considered, at the end of the day,
example: In the overall scheme of things, Facebook may still be useful to me, but it's no fun a-tall!
Huh-what channel do you want now that I have the remote in my hot little hands?

mommentary: Momism partially by virtue of how often mom says it
example: Indeed, sonnnn

mommentary: I didn't invent that, you know. It's a variant on "inquiring minds wish to know"
example: Inquiring moms wish to know

momism: It takes ten "attaboys" to make up for one "aw-shit"
mommentary: Honorary grand-momism
definition: It's easier to prevent mistakes than to clean them up
A mild exclamation of surprise, emotion, or awe

example: The walk just about did me in

definition: Imperative: calm down or be patient

mommentary: Mom identified this momism. Variant: kerpooey
definition: Interjection, used to represent an explosion; a mix of kaboom and kerflooey
example: Before my computer goes kerblooie

mommentary: Mareseatoatsanddoeseatoatsandlittlelambseativy, akid'lleativytoo, wouldn'tyou-ooo? I can't say that I coined kiddlie [sic], but I've certainly done my part to perpetrate the word!
example: You kiddlies and your busy boxes — Brown Boy has his piano and now this!

definition: Refers to her daughter 90% of the time, the other 10% refers to another killer baby who reminds her of her daughter as a baby

example: It's time to launch your brother

definition: A lawyer, pronounced literally law-yer, as opposed to loy-yer
example: You would make a great, law-yer, sonnnn

momism: Let's get this show on the road

mommentary: I think my dad made that one up, since I never heard anyone else say it
example: Enough talking, let's mush

mommentary: "Library paste" refers to food that is not just goopy but also completely without flavor, like unadulterated oatmeal.
example: I can’t eat any more library paste, even if it comes from a librarian. I miss hot sauce!
We'd better buy kefir. You go through it like a dose of salts. pause Mom: You'd better go put that on the list

momism: Like a gemstone in a rock tumbler
mommentary: Mom just made it up but it was good. N.B. mom gets motion sickness easily
example: On that flight, I was like a gemstone in a rock tumbler

definition: With great speed, intensity, vigour, impact, or success
example: I tip like gangbusters at restaurants.

definition: Modified from like father, like son. In the same manner from generation to generation
example: You want to be a librarian? Like mother, like daughter.

mommentary: Momism of the year 2023
example: I'm going to post that interesting link on Second Language Acquisition to the linguine listserv
He saw a little old lady in need of "COFFEE"

definition: Survive, make it, manage the circumstances in question
example: I think I can go for a walk today and live to tell about it
My grandfather had a tile factory before the hurricane of 1926 whomped the living stew out of Miami

definition: Someone who puts up with a lot, implies patience through tribulation
example: Give it a rest, sonnnn! Your long-suffering mama needs to conk out and your busy box isn't helping matters
You planted Rose of Sharon — have you lost your mind?

definition: We assume that a wet hen is quite angry

mommentary: I guess other people don’t say that, come to think of it. I think I got that from my mom
example: A certain Quaker is a mixed blessing, sometimes pleasant and sometimes a major-league pain in the butt

definition: To consume or use up quickly
example: Your sister made quick work of that sandwich

mommentary: I think "means business" is a momism only if it's said in a kind of condescending way. Like, a toddler who's playing with blocks with a serious expression on their face "means business" in a momism sense but not so much an adult who's taking something that's serious seriously
definition: Someone is serious about something, especially something about which it's laughable to take seriously
example: She may just be playing with blocks but she has the killer baby look — she means business!

mommentary: Long ago, one of you taught me how to make hearts on Facebook Messenger, ❤ , and at that time I pointed out that you had created a momster. At first I thought to point out that the child in question had created a monster, then realized I could do it one better. I am the guilty party. The rest is history.

definition: A long time (literally, a month of Sundays would be 30 weeks)
example: I haven't seen a cassette player in a month of Sundays

definition: The usual definition is that one approves of what someone is doing and hopes it will be successful. However, in mom's case, there is also a skepticism that the scheme will be successful

example: The Mouthy One has been fed but is still giving me an earful

definition: Synonym: I had a senior moment

mommentary: A momism by virtue of how often mom says it.
example: That’s my idea of a good time

mommentary: Mom identified this momism
example: I don't mean to be a nervous Nellie about my operating system.
Typing properly is no small thing
Like I tried to get the printer to work but no soap

definition: Not particularly fulfilling, not a fun lifestyle.
example: No FreeGeek and no walks by the lake, this is no way to live
If I tried that at my age, I'd go nose over pinfeathers

momism: Not for the faint of heart
example: (After watching a man capture an alligator using only a trash can) Life in Florida is not for the faint of heart!
Your sister just about did me in with that three-hour walk. I'm not getting any younger, you know

definition: Not feeling well, not in good condition
It's nearing my bedtime; I'm about to turn into a pumpkin
example: If you want my help cleaning up, ask now. I'm not long for this world

momism: Not out of the woods yet
mommentary: Often talking about getting over a cold but not exclusively
definition: Things are improving but not completely better yet
example: I know your fever has gone down but you've still got quite a cough--you're not out of the woods yet!

momism: Not to be too much of a linguist
definition: Mother is definitely too much of a linguist
example: Not to be too much of a linguist but huh-what a diphtong!

momism: Nothing left of [someone] but a grease spot
mommentary: Mom added this definition.
definition: An extreme experience, as in spontaneous combustion.

example: He had a nuclear-powered twinkle in his eye while making that pun.

definition: Off of one's posterior; to mobilize.
example: If I can ever get off my duff, I'll run the dishwasher.

mommentary: An "off the wall sense of humor" is the first example that occurred to me!
example: That off-the-wall sense of humor

definition: Opposite of youngster, an elderly person
example: An oldster like me can't go up and down those hills like you kids can
So long as you smell, I'm going to be on your case about wearing deodorant
That operation over on Devon.

definition: Your proposed solution will likely resolve the problem, that should suffice
example: I'll use this sticky tack to keep your cabinet door from banging against the wall. That ought to do the trick
The internet is out of commission until my router gets fixed.

mommentary: Idiom: a bolt from the blue?
Momism partially by virtue of how often mom says it
Definition right from the source
definition: To reach across a table to get something rather than asking for it to be passed

mommentary: I  think that huh-when I come up with a momism (give or take), I'm oftentimes trying to make an ordinary turn of phrase into something more interesting. "Get" is pretty ho-hum, "fetch" is a more interesting (& less often-used) equivalent; "sit," yawn, "park oneself," say huh-what? I'm trying to fight linguistic boredom one momism at a time.
example: I’m going to go park myself on a bench by Lake Michigan huh-while you three go to the bathroom.

mommentary: Other people don't say this?
example: From now on, I want peace and quiet or else your name is mud
The cat's favorite perch on the stairway
You know me and my photo hobby

definition: Adjective meaning someone is unusually unpleasant, difficult, or behaves particularly badly
example: You're a piece of work, lovey

mommentary: Mom identified this momism

definition: Become extremely upset or angry in a loud and uncontrolled way, having a tantrum, making a scene
To look around, to look through things, to investigate
example: I'm going to go poke around the Chalet

definition: Eat the rest of a dish
example: Your brother polished off those bagels in one sitting.
I pop awake every morning at quarter to five

mommentary: Usage: [insert the blank] life.
example: Post-adolescent life!

mommentary: Problems, you've got problems is my sympathetic way of suggesting there might be some melodrama involved. It has a Yiddish-English flavor to it. I have no idea where I acquired such a useful phrase, but there've been a lot of Jewish people in my life. With this one, I visualize Linda Harris's mom (college friend whose parents lived in Durham; I visited them for years after she moved away).
definition: You're being melodramatic, mom has no sympathy for whatever you're complaining about
example: "I stayed up too late last night and now I'm tired and still have to go to school and take an exam I'm not ready for" "Problems, you've got problems, baby!"

mommentary: All things are either promising or not promising
definition: Something that has good future prospects
example: Hmm, that pitch black sky on the horizon doesn't look too promising!
Ever since I quit it with the hot sauce, my food has been pretty punk

mommentary: "Pushing your luck" I most likely acquired from my mom. "Pushing it" I'm not so sure, maybe just me playing with language. In my mind, they both mean the same thing, but I would only say "you're pushing it" to someone who already knew about "pushing your luck," my kids, e.g.
definition: Pushing your luck, you're an inch from being in serious trouble
example: "Mom, can we go to Walker Bros this weekend?" "Oh alright, it's been a huh-while since we had a treat like that!" "Can we go for ice cream afterwards?" "Now you're pushing it, Annebeth! Pick one."

mommentary: Mom self-identified this momism
definition: Exclamation: to be quiet, shut up

mommentary: Mom identified this momism
(Lowell-ism)

example: Quit it, your squabbling is driving me bonkers

mommentary: The verb, not the noun, is a momism.
example: Quit your rabble rousing, sonnnn! Can't your old mama have a moment's peace without you stirring up trouble?!
Quit making such a racket; I can't hear myself think

definition: Awake and moving around the house
example: I could hear him rattling around long after I turned into a pumpkin
This COVID situation is really the pits
Your brother was a pain in the rear when he was little

definition: Something that is likely to result in disaster

mommentary: A regular gully-washer means it was a doozy of a rainstorm. The gully-washer is from the Texas side of the family, I believe.
example: Mom: "It was a regular gully washer!" Me: "What's a gully washer?" Mom: "It's a momism, dear"
After some remajiggering I got all those dang dishes in the dishwasher and it's running a rinse cycle as we speak
Make sure someone rides herd on you after your vaccine
Your brother came rip-roaring around the corner

momism: Roll up your pants, it's too late to save your shoes

mommentary: Seems to me a perch is more temporary
example: I'm looking for a bench upon which to roost

mommentary: That's from Shakespeare

definition: To have irritated or offended someone

mommentary: Other people don't say "scads"? Yet another Momism surprises the Mom. ♥
example: "There are scads of people in the grocery store today" — mom, the day before Thanksgiving

mommentary: Yiddishisms live
definition: To carry something heavy or bulky

mommentary: Hmm. That does sound like something I'd say. As for others saying it, no clue. The usual figure of speech is "I'll see huh-what I can do," I think, so it could be I coined my version to mean what I might perceive in the future, but not work that might be done.
definition: I have yet to gather evidence to make a conclusion on this topic but I'll look into it
example: I haven't been down to the Custer Street Fair to look for birthday presents yet, but I'll see huh-what I can see
Those socks have seen better days: they’re filled with holes

mommentary: A momism for non-literal usage
example: You can set up shop on the kitchen, where the internet is a bit better

mommentary: First posthumous momism
definition: Adjective describing a person who has a nice body
example: "You've always been shapely, daughter-of-mine, unlike your poor mama!"

definition: Mom's Yiddish streak: a show or an act

momism: Snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
mommentary: That phrase was popular with respect to Duke basketball in the days before the present - successful - coach Mike Krzyzewski
definition: A play on the inverse phrase (snatching victory from the jaws of defeat), this momism means losing something that was nearly won

mommentary: See downright nippy

I do remember settling down in the evenings to watch "the evening snooze," a few minutes of Peter Jennings @5:30 p.m., zzzzz..., then final credits; then Star Trek @6:00 p.m. for a few minutes, more zzzzz..., then the credits. Funniest of all to me, though, was settling in on Saturday afternoons to watch Buffy the Vampire Slayer with baby doll: a few minutes, zzzzzzz..., waking up for the credits, then asking her about huh-what I missed. She tended to be a bit cross about clueing me in ("well, you could just stay awake and watch it for yourself" more or less).
definition: The news, refers to the fact that mom routinely falls asleep while watching the news or, really, anything on television
example: I'm going to go watch the snooze and then we'll see about huh-what's for dinner.
Cat, quit snorkeling me!
Get me out of here before I snuffocate!
Sonnnn, why did you wake me from my nap?

definition: Someone who seeks out spicy food.
example: Your mother the spicer is at it with the hit sauce again!
Now that you're all squared away and ready to go to school, I'm going to go see about your brother!
We cleaned from stem to stern

definition: A contemptible or very unpleasant person or thing
example: That little stinker took off with my socks!

definition: Exclamation indicating that an idea, although unlikely, is within the realm of possibility
It is enough to say this and no more
example: Suffice it to say that the judge was furious when the invitation was withdrawn

mommentary: I got that from my supervisor in academic medicine. He's from the Bronx: "supa dupa!" Huh-what ever happened to the R?
example: Your family doctor was super duper.

momism: Sure as God made little green apples

example: I cleaned the yard and planted flowers in one swell foop
You really take after your dear old mother
My daughter was quite taken with "woo-wee-sa."

momism: Talk the leaves off a tree
mommentary: That comes from a college roommate from Boston
definition: Someone who often speaks at great length

example: Cat, stop tenderizing me!

mommentary: That was a common figure of speech in high school.
definition: That’s all she wrote, that’s the end.

momism: The bottom is going to drop out
definition: It's going to rain really hard

example: You're annoyed because there's no cheese left? Thee and me, sonnnn.

momism: They get along like a house afire

example: Mom: They are really having a to-do up there. Me: That is so going on the list

mommentary: Brown boy's all-time favourite momism
We are but a flower being moved from pot to pot as we grow
definition: Immigrant, someone who moves from their home city/state/province/territory/country to another
example: I've heard McGill has groups organized for transplants like you and your brother. Wouldn't it be nice to meet fellow Americans-turned-Canadians?

mommentary: Oh yes, poor dear eldest child, indeed you were & still are the trial balloon. To me it meant a sort of a grand experiment. I didn't look up the definition in a thesaurus (and there was no internet back then!).
example: Sonnnn, as the eldest, you're the trial balloon.

mommentary: "As a noun, troop refers to a group of soldiers or a collection of people or things. As a verb, troop means to move or spend time together. The noun troupe refers specifically to a group of theatrical performers."
definition: To move together as a group
example: On Halloween I was trooping around with a lot of peopIe who I didn't know

definition: A loyal, dependable worker or participant in an undertaking
An inept person, usually related to mom's road rage
example: Who let that turkey drive
Well, the sun is setting, sonnnn, so I'm going to go turn into a pumpkin

mommentary: Defining one momism with another. Mom™
example: Kid: "nose over pinfeathers," what does that mean? Mom: turning turtle

definition: So many times it's impossible to count
example: He has played that Adagio for Strings umteen times now

mommentary: Did you know that I got the US mule from a cartoon when I was a kid; it was called Li'l Abner. It is political satire

definition: 1.) Something or someone of great age. 2) the age of someone or something
example: 1. I'm becoming vintage. 2. Someone of my vintage.

momism: Were you raised in a barn?
mommentary: Momism of the year: 2017.
example: Eating with your fingers, were you raised in a barn? Kids: yes!

definition: "Gadzooks!" Mom demands "what is the matter with you" with a "head of steam" when she wants to know what "hare brained scheme" we "dubious" youngsters are "getting up to", and whether we're "in cahoots" or "roaring around" alone
example: Huh-what is the matter with you, feline — do you have kibbles for brains or are you just suicidal?

momism: What is this world coming to?
mommentary: The kids discovered this momism straight from the source in her response to baby doll's proposal that "mind boggling" is a momism
definition: Expression of disbelief and often disapproval of how the times are a-changin'
example: "Pink polka dots on a lime green dress?! Huh-what is this world coming to??"
I have no clue as to huh-what-all you-all saw

mommentary: Referring to the likelihood that the answer to the question has several parts
example: Who-all did you-all go to France with?

definition: A bit like the whole nine yards; the entirety of, the whole set.

mommentary: Kind of like "the whole nine yards"
definition: The whole shebang, everything, the entire thing

mommentary: My daughter caught herself saying it the other day, then I said it today
example: With my terrific niece and nephews I've got it all, the whole shooting match!

definition: To whomp is to hit. To whomp up is to make.
example: I'd better whomp up some oatmeal before we get whomped with another snowstorm
Might be time for a haircut, sonnn, you are looking wild and woolly!
I'm going to grab a quick wink

momism: Within an inch of his life

example: You kids cooked dinner? Wonderful!

definition: This is a surprising turn of events, how out of character for you
example: Wonders never cease! First, adolescent life before noon and now you're doing the dishes willingly?

definition: Exclamation. Usually indicating an extremely determined baby
example: World conquering! That baby isn't gonna give up on walking
That half of American voters would choose George the Younger is worrisome in my view

definition: Someone with a tendency to worry habitually, often needlessly

example: Ye gods and little catfish!

definition: Indicates that something is as high as mom is pointing, usually not very high
example: That cat went past the wall about yea high [mom points] with that paintbrush in her mouth

momism: Yes, cat. no, cat. maybe, cat
mommentary: I think that one evolved during life with Milo, who I also referred to as "The Mouthy One" since she was always giving me an earful. Momism?
definition: Expression of sarcastic subordination to the cat

momism: You ever saw in your life
example: That noodle restaurant had just about the longest lineup you ever saw in your life.

momism: You have such a good [body part] for [task]
definition: Mother's preferred momism for describing an extraordinary skill
example: Dearheart, you have such a good eye for composition / Sonnnn, you have a great ear for idiosyncrasy
If you scratch me again, cat, your name is dog
If you take my last pen, your name is mud
That (sleeping) baby is zonked!
If I don’t hear the timer, my grits are going to get zorched

definition: Japanese-style flip-flops, often made of woven rice straw, sort of like tatamis you can wear on your feet

mommentary: Mother-identified momism
